identity.name: GovEnforce
identity.mission: Empower enforcement teams with clarity and speed.

headings.usage: Page titles, Card headers, Section markers

body.usage: General text, Data tables, Form inputs

rules: Use Primary Blue (#005EA5) for main actions and active states.
Backgrounds should be light grey (#F3F2F1) to create contrast with white content cards.
Text must always pass WCAG AA contrast (4.5:1).
Status colors must be used consistently: Red for violations/critical, Green for closed/success.

structure.mobile: Bottom navigation or Hamburger menu + Stacked content

specifics.cards: White background, 1px border, minimal shadow. Header separated by border.
specifics.buttons: Sharp corners (rounded-sm), high contrast text. Primary buttons are solid Blue.
specifics.inputs: High contrast borders (#0B0C0C) on focus for accessibility.
specifics.tables: Dense, zebra-striping optional, clear headers with sorting indicators.

visual_enhancers.textures: Minimal noise on dashboard backgrounds to reduce sterility (optional).
visual_enhancers.icons: Lucide React (Stroke width 1.5px for elegance, 2px for active states).
visual_enhancers.motion: Micro-interactions only. No sweeping page transitions. Fast (150ms) ease-out.

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'Swiss & High-Contrast' archetype. Prioritize clarity and data density.
Use 'Work Sans' for all headings and 'IBM Plex Sans' for body text. Import these via Google Fonts.
Ensure all interactive elements have 'data-testid' attributes.
Do NOT use gradients. Stick to solid, authoritative colors.
For the Dashboard, use a dense grid layout. Summary cards at top, detailed lists/maps below.
The 'Public Report' form must be accessible (no login required) and extremely simple.
Map views should use the provided placeholder image if a real map library is not being implemented yet, or overlay markers on top of it.
Strictly follow the color palette. Do not invent new shades of blue.
universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) ONLY for overlays/modals, not main content.
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: `transition: all`. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add `.App { text-align: center; }` in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
